entry.title: Humane Launches Wearable AI Pin With a $700 Price Tag
entry.summary: The small device integrates AI into daily life for a price, but privacy concerns loom.

entry.title: Roblox CEO Envisions In-Game NFTs as Part of Open Ecosystem 'Dream'
entry.summary: Roblox CEO David Baszucki said that limited edition NFT items could launch in the future as part of an open ecosystem. But will it happen?

entry.title: Why the Creator of Netflix's 'Selena' Is Saying No to Hollywood—And Yes to NFTs
entry.summary: Moisés Zamora, a veteran of the studio system, is now launching an NFT-backed platform for indie filmmakers called Videomart.

entry.title: Ethereum Rockets Past $2,100 as BlackRock Files for Ethereum ETF with NASDAQ
entry.summary: The fund's shares would trade under the ticker "ETH" and closely track the price of Ethereum.

entry.title: Still Got Useless Reddit Moons? Here’s How to Turn Them Into Bitcoin
entry.summary: You soon won’t be able to do anything with Reddit’s cryptocurrency, but you can still cash them out.

entry.title: Ethereum Has Gone Deflationary Again—Here's Why and What It Means
entry.summary: ETH this week had its first prolonged deflationary period in months. But what’s driving the trend, and how long can it keep going?

entry.title: A Bitcoin Dev’s Bot Bucked BRC-20s—Now He Might Share ‘The Sophon’ With the World
entry.summary: Text-based inscriptions associated with BRC-20s plummeted 72% after the code was unleashed. There's signs someone is running a copy of it.

entry.title: Want Free Rare Pokémon Cards? Courtyard Is Giving Them Away via NFTs
entry.summary: Crypto collectibles startup Courtyard is giving away hundreds of branded mystery packs containing graded and tokenized Pokémon cards.

entry.title: Celsius to Emerge from Bankruptcy With Repayment Plan Approved
entry.summary: Backed by a new entity with $450 million in seed funding, the failed crypto lender may come back to life.

entry.title: Enhanced Steam Deck OLED Handheld Gaming PC Coming Next Week
entry.summary: Valve's enhanced Steam Deck OLED upgrades the handheld gaming PC with a better screen, longer battery life, and other tweaks.

entry.title: OneCoin Legal Chief Pleads Guilty to Role in Cryptoqueen's $4 Billion Fraud
entry.summary: Irina Dilkinska admitted in Manhattan federal court to helping launder $110 million in illicit profits generated through OneCoin.

author.name: Decrypt AI, Edited by Stacy Elliot

entry.title: Moisés Zamora on Videomart and Bucking the Hollywood System
entry.summary: "Selena: The Series" creator and co-showrunner Moisés Zamora joins Decrypt's Sander Lutz at the Film3 Summit 2023 to discuss why the Hollywood system is broken and why he founded the Videomart NFT digital film marketplace to give creators more power.

entry.title: You Can Now Lend Your NFTs to Gamers and Earn Passive Income
entry.summary: LootRush will let gamers list their NFTs for rent on its marketplace, allowing them to earn passive income for game items like cards and land.

entry.title: Ethereum Tops $2,000 for First Time Since July
entry.summary: Ethereum has followed Bitcoin's rally today, rallying past the $2,000 mark.

entry.title: BlackRock Registers Ethereum Trust in Delaware—ETH ETF Next?
entry.summary: Analysts say the registration could be a precursor for an ETF filing.

entry.title: Why OTK Is Making Video Games
entry.summary: One True King (OTK) Chief Strategy Officer Zachary Diaz tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about OTK's long-term strategy and vision to become a content creator-powered media and video games company.

entry.title: Bitcoin Soars Past $37,000, Touching 18-Month High on ETF Optimism
entry.summary: Bitcoin is rallying on optimism surrounding the approval of a spot Bitcoin exchange-traded fund.

entry.title: Business Sim Game Legacy Launches With Competitive Events on Gala Games
entry.summary: Players can take part in events including design and sales competitions to win in-game Gems.

entry.title: Yuga Labs Says 'UV-A Emitting Lights' to Blame for ApeFest Attendees' Eye Pain
entry.summary: Owners of the Bored Ape Yacht Club NFT collection complained of eye pain following the three-day ApeFest event in Hong Kong.

entry.title: FTT Token Jumps 84% Following Gensler's FTX Revival Comments
entry.summary: FTX's token surged following reports that the exchange could be revived—though there's no indication the token would be part of that revival.

entry.title: SAG-AFTRA Ends Strike After Deal to Protect Actors From 'Threat of AI'
entry.summary: The "tentative agreement" between the actors' union and the AMPTP reportedly hinged on clauses regarding the use of AI.

entry.title: Assassin's Creed Maker Ubisoft Is Building a Crypto 'Gaming Experience' With Immutable
entry.summary: Ubisoft and Immutable are developing a new blockchain gaming project that plans to offer "digital ownership." Here's what we know so far.

entry.summary: Hitting out at the SEC Chair, Representative Tom Emmer called Gary Gensler “ineffective” and “incompetent.”

entry.summary: YouTube’s AI tool aims to turn comment chaos into organized insights.

entry.summary: Lavish Immutable X game Illuvium is coming to the Epic Games Store, and the news fueled a spike in the ILV token price.

entry.summary: “Dr. Doom” used Binance’s brand recognition to promote his new blockchain venture, just months after calling CZ a "ticking time bomb."

entry.title: 5 Questions With SCENE: LoVid
entry.summary:
Artistic duo LoVid, aka Tali Hinkis and Kyle Lapidus, joins 5 Questions with SCENE to answer burning questions about art, lettuce, and the hellscape (in someone’s opinion) that is Miami.
Video shot and edited by Vincent Roazzi Jr.

entry.title: Microsoft, Meta Lay Down AI Rules to Safeguard Elections
entry.summary: Focusing on authenticity and transparency ahead of 2024, two tech titans outline measures to combat AI-powered political disinformation.

entry.summary: Axie Infinity’s Ronin network is growing as more games launch, tripling active users and pumping the price of RON.

entry.summary: Sen. Ted Budd said his bill is meant to ensure Americans can "maintain control over their own digital assets."

entry.title: Bitcoin ATMs in El Salvador are Getting a Lightning Network Upgrade
entry.summary: The switch will "enable smaller and potentially more frequent transactions," according to Genesis Coin.

entry.title: Barney on DeFi, Privacy, and Vega
entry.summary:
This week our host is joined by Barney the founder of Vega Protocol.
They discuss the current state of DeFi, what's wrong with the apps being built today, whether or not privacy matters when its only applied to an L2, and most importantly-- which form of sales tax is the sexiest.

entry.title: 'Disrespectful and Dangerous': Video Game Writers, Actors Blast Microsoft for Xbox AI Tools
entry.summary: Microsoft is making more AI tools, but game industry talent are very concerned that the Xbox AI push will lead to more job losses.

entry.title: Gucci Cosmos Land Opens in The Sandbox Metaverse Game
entry.summary: Luxury house Gucci brings its London historical exhibit into the metaverse with Gucci Cosmos Land in The Sandbox.

entry.title: HSBC, Ripple-Backed Metaco to Launch Tokenized Custody Service Next Year
entry.summary: HSBC continues to plow ahead with tokenization, this time partnering with Metaco for a new institutional custody service slated for 2024.

entry.title: Investors Bet $5.5 Million on Stackr to Onboard JavaScript Devs to Crypto
entry.summary: With an aim to onboard more developers to crypto, Stackr has landed fresh funding to make that transition even easier.

entry.title: Why Is Phantom Galaxies Releasing Two Versions of Its Game?
entry.summary: Animoca Brands-owned Blowfish Studios is building a space mech pilot game called Phantom Galaxies. Blowfish Cofounder Ben Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his plans for the game's release.

entry.title: Sophie Maxx on NFTs, Augmented Reality, and Fashion
entry.summary: This week our host is joined by Sophie Maxx (Web3Maxx) to discuss NFTs, augmented reality, the metaverse, how blockchain is sneaking into the fashion world, and more!

entry.title: 5 Questions With SCENE: Kevin Rose
entry.summary:
Kevin Rose, co-founder and CEO of PROOF and co-creator of the hit Moonbirds NFT collection, joins 5 Questions with SCENE to answer some hard-hitting questions about his childhood dreams, his wife’s candy preferences, and his undying love of rap music.
Video shot and edited by Vincent Roazzi Jr.

entry.title: What Happened to Atari's Token? Inside Atari's Blockchain Plans
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Atari X director Tyler Drewitz about what happened with Atari's token plans, whether a token is coming, and what Atari games might be getting the blockchain treatment. Oh, and there's lots of Easter eggs.

entry.title: Twitch CEO Dan Clancy Is a 'Wild Card,' Says Marketing Director
entry.summary: Twitch Senior Director of Community Marketing Mary Kish speaks with Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Twitch CEO Dan Clancy, Ninja, Twitch's new simulcasting rules, the biggest differences between Twitch and rival platform Kick, and the role of esports on the streaming platform.

entry.title: Why NFT Paris has Launched a Loyalty Token
entry.summary: NFT Paris founder Alexandre Tsydenkov told Decrypt what to expect from the upcoming 2024 edition of the conference, the launch of its loyalty token and its plans to create a Web3 loyalty program that rewards the most engaged members of the community.

entry.title: Game Review—Formula E: High Voltage Is a Fun Play-to-Earn Racer That Lacks Direction
entry.summary:
Formula E: High Voltage is a play-to-earn racing game with a distinctive strategic approach. Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin put Animoca's web-based game through its paces in this review, highlighting the unique gameplay design, the role of NFTs and crypto, and where the game currently comes up short.

entry.title: Amanda Cassatt on Web3 Marketing and the early days of Ethereum
entry.summary:
In this week's episode, our host is joined by Amanda Cassatt!
Amanda is the founder of Serotonin, a web3 marketing agency, the author of the first book ever published on web3 marketing, and led the marketing team that helped bring Ethereum to market.

entry.title: Midnight Society's Rob Bowling on Deadrop's New Cars and User-Generated Modes
entry.summary: Decrypt reporter and GG producer Kate Irwin interviews Midnight Society Studio Head Rob Bowling about Deadrop's development and Snapshot VII.

entry.title: Game Review: 'Raini: The Lords of Light' Brands Itself With Memes
entry.summary: Raini: Lords of Light is an NFT-optional card game bursting with crypto memes. From SBF to CZ and Elon, this free-to-play game has some truly wild animations. Decrypt contributor Ryan S. Gladwin shares his honest thoughts on the game.

entry.title: Art Blocks Marfa Weekend Recap
entry.summary: Relive the Art Blocks Marfa Weekend 2023 event with this highlights video, produced by Vincent Roazzi Jr. for Decrypt Studios in partnership with Art Blocks.

entry.title: Phantom Galaxies: A Look Inside the Mech Shooter NFT Game
entry.summary: Animoca Brands and game studio Blowfish are developing Phantom Galaxies, an upcoming sci-fi mech shooter game inspired by mech battlers like Transformers. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks Blowfish Studios Cofounder and Managing Director Ben Lee about what it's like to play the game.

entry.title: BackTheBunny - Money, Conspiracy, Milady
entry.summary:
Our host Reza Jafery sits down with BackTheBunny to dive deep into money, the fight against crypto that we're witnessing in real-time, and milady culture.

entry.title: 'A Grand Experiment': Shrapnel Studio Head Don Norbury Talks Game Economics
entry.summary: How much of Shrapnel's in-game items are tradeable NFTs? Don Norbury, Studio Head at Shrapnel and CTO at game studio NEON, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Shrapnel's approach to game economics, including different game pricing models and how NFT game economies create different challenges for developers.
